newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Kyoei Steel in Vietnam deepwater port project.
newsitem.headline: Kyoei Steel in Vietnam deepwater port project.

text.p: Vietnam has approved a venture between Japan's Kyoei Steel and two state-owned firms to build a $56 million deepwater port in the southern province of Ba Gia-Vung Tau, a project official said on Saturday.
Le Van Long, director of the Vung Tau Sea Transport and Service Company, said Kyoei Steel would have a 52 percent share in the Thi Vai port project.
His company would take 25.6 percent of the equity and Vietnam Steel Corporation would have the remaining 22.4 percent.
The port will be capable of accomodating container vessels of 30,000-50,000 tonnes.
